alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:01PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Elbert, central Arapahoe, southwestern Morgan and central Adams Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 300 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Prospect Valley to 4 miles southwest of Byers to 6 miles northwest of Kiowa, or along a line extending from 36 miles southwest of Fort Morgan to 42 miles northwest of Limon to 31 miles southeast of Denver. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. A brief landspout was reported 7 miles south of Bennett near 250 PM MDT. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennett, Deer Trail, Hoyt, Strasburg, Leader and Byers. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
